(40) 481.November 18, 1940.TO BE KEPT UNDER LOCK AND KEY.It is requested that special care may be taken toensure the secrecy of this document.WAR CABINET.GOVERNMENT DEPARTMENTS : PROTECTED ACCOMMODATION.THE disused underground station at Dover Street can be made suitable for occupation by Government functionaries at a cost of 15,000 approximately.It would be necessary to adapt to this use existing passages 70 feet belowthe street level. Provision is made in the estimated cost for protecting the liftshafts against bomb-penetration.The accommodation is detached from the Green Park station, which would,however, afford a secondary exit in case of emergency.If I have not already the authority of the Cabinet to carry out this project,Memorandum by the Minister of Aircraft Production.I ask it now.(Initialled)B.Ministry of Aircraft Production, S.W. 1,November 18, 1940.[21932]
